algorithm_technique: Iterative traversal with group reversal using pointer manipulation.
problem_summary_simple: Reverse nodes in a linked list in groups of k, leaving the last group unchanged if it's smaller than k.
problem_summary_technical: Iteratively traverse a linked list, reversing segments of k nodes using pointer manipulation and a dummy node for O(1) space.
key_insights: A dummy node simplifies handling the head of the list and edge cases.
The core logic involves carefully re-wiring pointers within each k-group.
Tracking the end of the previous group is crucial for connecting reversed segments.
